intro: Atylus buxifolius, commonly known as the boxleaf atylus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that resemble those of boxwood, hence its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Atylus buxifolius is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
